Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: cathy67s
Reviews.Content: This was without doubt the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. It was absolutely filthy. I have posted some photographs so that you can see the disgusting conditions I stayed in. It was advertised as a 4 star hotel - this should have said minus 4 stars.DON'T GO THERE!!!!! If you do you'll be sorry

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!”
Reviews.Author: Skier0
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as part of a school's rugby tour which was visiting Rome - the boys were in a 3* and the lucky parents were put into this hotel as it was a 4*. Not sure where the star ratings come from, but it was a very poor advert for the starring system! On arrival we discovered that most of the other parents had already checked out and gone somewhere else! We were given a key to our room which was on the 5th floor - the door would not shut unless we locked it and even then it was a struggle and there was barely any room to get the 2 suitcases in, nevery mind 2 people. The bathroom was tiny and the shower difficult to get into although to be fair the water was hot. The towels were minute and had holes in. Breakfast consisted of a coffee machine which made the most disgusting coffee, which had a rather nasty scum on top of it, and the croissants were fairly dry. Jam to help these along was either pink or orange in colour, but certainly not anything in taste! We lasted 2 nights here before checking out and going to join the other parents in a much better 4* hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lux is not short for Luxurious!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1DFan
Reviews.Content: Four star hotel??? I don't think so, more like minus two star. I was on a school trip we first stayed in a lovely hotel in Sorrento and then came up to Rome with high expectations that our hotel would be equally as nice as the previous one. We were wrong!!! It's not as if we are a fussy bunch of teenagers, but we do expect the basics, even the teachers that were with us were complaining! First of all my room was absolutely tiny - a twin room with four beds! We struggled to fit our regular sized suitcases in the room. Second, our door wouldn't close or lock properly, which made us all rather uncomfortable. Third, there was a fusty smell in every room and some rooms smelt damp, thankfully ours didn't. In a classmates room, there was a blood stain on the curtain and the toilet wouldn't flush properly. One of the sockets in our room was broken. The shower door wouldn't close right. Our beds were extremely low and there was poor lighting in the room. Everyone was very cramped in the hotel. The corridors were narrow and it was very awkward for 42 noisy and excited sixteen year olds to move around in. Then the breakfast ................uuuugh! I couldn't eat anything - no joke and I am not a fussy eater. The croissants had blue mould on them, the bread was hard, no toaster, no orange juice (pineapple juice which nobody likes instead), sweet milk, smelly water and the delph was cracked and chipped. Luckily I had brought some food so I didn't starve in the morning. Being typical Irish teenagers, most of us can't survive without the cup of tea, guess what?? No tea, but a classmate brought teabags so we survived. The hotel doesn't even have a kitchen i.e. no oven,grill or microwave. Some of the teachers that have porridge every morning couldn't even have it because there was no microwave, mad isn't it? We were told by the hotel staff (who by the way were super rude and grumpy and I'm not letting them away with the excuse of having noisy teenagers around, because we were fairly quiet!) that we could have the drinks in the mini fridge free of charge, but on check out they were looking for us to pay for the drinks, we refused and they weren't too impressed. I had a great time in Rome and spent as little time a possible in the hotel. To say the hotel was disappointing is an understatement and I will never be returning to Hotel Lux! By the way if anyone is still interested in staying at Hotel Lux, the cost for a twin room B&B for one night is €100!! Fantastic value - i don't think so!

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather die...”
Reviews.Author: kathrynnr
Reviews.Content: I was very unfortune having to stay at this hole for the last two nights of a contiki tour. the staff was super rude and at night don't even wear a uniforms. our check out was at 10:30, and the maids started yelling in the hall at 8 am then began hounding us from 9 am onwards to leave by coming in, calling the room and even yelling to check- out. i had been travel for 4 weeks before this contiki tour and any hostel Kills this hole. also not to mention the Dirty sewer smell of the room.

Reviews.Title: “You will regret your stay”
Reviews.Author: sevenos
Reviews.Content: 4 stars hotel? There are far better 2 stars in the city. So If you're going to Italy, rule number 1; never trust the stars. I was stuck in that hotel for 2 days because I was with a tour but later we moved to another hotel just next door of Lux (not giving name), It was much better. In hotel Lux, you don't get extra pillows, If you are thirsty you have to walk 2 or 3 streets to the market. And in a double room someone has to be on the bed so the other can stand in the room or turn around 360°. In short, listen to what others comment here and stay away from that hotel and never book a hotel without actually seeing the rooms first hand.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Slavica_11
Reviews.Content: I went there with my mother and it was supposed to be our trip to remember. But... The room had no separated beds, so we had to sleep together. They also gave us one sheet for both of us, so I had to ask for an extra sheet! The bed had very dirty cover, which I immediately took off and put it in a tiny closet together together with their dirty pillows (we brought our own pillows thanks to previous reviews on TripAdvisor). Nevertheless, every day the cleaning lady took them out of the closet and put it back on the bed. It was disgusting! The room itself was so small that we barely put our bags inside. Ofcourse, unpacking was out of question, because of lack of space. The bathroom was disgusting: The shower cabin was falling apart and full of mold. The toilet bowl was just like on the picture that somebody attached on this web site previously. Breakfast: Dirty and old cutlery, bread from yesterday, ham good for rats maybe... O yeah, not to forget salty coffee... The staff was very polite and alyaws at service... until the last day. Then they told us that we had to leave our rooms not later than 10 am, athough it was written on the info sheet in the room that we could stay until noon. When I complained, they said nothing... Air condition: in late may it is very hot in Rome, so the temperature in our room was 28 C. When I realized that the air condition could only heat and not cool, they told me that they will allow cooling from June 1st! Neigborhood: not so good, maybe even dangerous! Don't stay there. If nothing rent an appartment, it will be better.

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever hotel”
Reviews.Author: alwaysblond
Reviews.Content: We had only 2 nights in Rome and had our booking in another hotel (3*), which was also nearby Termini. On the check in day we were told that our hotel had temporary problem with water supply, but we would have a room in alternative hotel, same quality around the corner. That was LUX hotel. When has taxi dopeed us there we were nicely surprized to see that this was 4 star hotel and were excited by that only fact...But later when we went to our room were were surprised even more when we dicovered that room was too small for the hotel of that category, bathroom was small and awfull and not really clean. Double bad was not really double but rather 1.5 person size. Night was cold and we were searching for tha blanket in the room and found one in the wardrobe, but it was so old and dirty like it has never been washed. I went to the reception and asked to change the blanket but the guy on the reception could not undrestand what I was talking about and first brought me a sheet but not blanket , finally we managed to understand each other. But the replacement was not even better, at least it was a clean blanket but also like 20 years old. TV did not work, in the morning my husband got angly cause he counld not close door of the shower cabin and then shower held down and hit his to the head once he turned the water. I was also not lucky when I turned on the hair dryier and the pipe was broken from the main body . Breakfast...this is another story deserving another 10 minutes typing. I used to stay in 2 starts hotels in different cities like Amsterdam and London, but the breakfasts there were much better and fresh and you can not even compare with lux breakfast in that lux 4 star hotel. I really wonder how ministry of tourism could confirm they are 4 stars? I specifically checked this form, which is attaced in every room cause I could not belive my eyes I was staying in 4 start hotel and I though I was mistaken, but indeed the form for 2011 was saing this was 4 star hotel and was proved by the authority stamp.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationsrbest
Reviews.Content: The hotel it was not a 4 star hotel..our room it was very very small, the same with the bathroom..We stay there for 3 nights and the second day we didn't have hot water for shower..the other two days the water presure it was low and it wasn't easy to take a shower. A good suprice it was the breakfast, it was very good..not a 4start breakfast but it was good!!Not very friendly staff, they did'nt speak english..they did'nt care about the problem with the water.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation but very clean hotel and polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: maleda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Lux for 3 nights as part of a large group. I was given a single room which was as small as a closet and with a view of a wall from my window. Feeling immediately claustrophobic, I asked the hotel for another room. Very apologetically, they offered me a more spacious double room with a balcony which was a big improvement! Although by far not luxurious, I found the hotel very clean and pleasant with very polite and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK”
Reviews.Author: sbprz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible: we slept in a one person room, which was provided with cots to make it a four person room. The mould fell from the walls. the shower is not to be used: electrically unsafe! Breakfast only if you need to see an italian hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: parishoes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lux as the leader of a group of students from the US. I have traveled to Europe many times, both on my own and with students, so I feel I know what to expect from a three star European hotel. This one was well below par. The shower was broken and grungy looking. The beds were acceptable but the sheets were quite rough. The breakfast was terrible: poor coffee, hard, stale bread, fruit that was past its prime...etc. Worst of all was the noise level. Each time a door opened and shut the walls would shake. When in the lobby, the sound echoed from above as it would in a busy indoor pool. Unlike other posters, I didn't mind the neighborhood. I am sure you can do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “small and pretty”
Reviews.Author: venividibegendi
Reviews.Content: i didn't expect much from a 3 star european hotel, we were just concidered about if it's clean or not. Its location is important than the other stuff. And its 10 min. far from the city center and I can say it's clean. We stayed there 3 days. Everyday we found the room clean, bed was done, new soaps in the bathroom when we back to the room... Breakfast was also better than i imagined. There were cakes, turtas and fruit juice beside butter, jam, cheese or ham. Some staff were helpful and kind, some of them didn't . One night the receptionist has locked the hotels main door and was sleeping when we return to the hotel at 3 a.m. :) At last i can recommend it to the people who looks for basic standards and don't want to lose time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: travellerHungary
Reviews.Content: We were here at the end of october. Our experience is very good. The room was tiny, but clean, and comfortable, cleaning was every day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect, Termini Railway Station, and Castro Pretorio metro station are walking distance, from there you can go to every important place of Rome. The hotel's area seems safe, next to hotel there are embassies, and other offices. We offer this hotel to everyone. ( For Hungarian tourists: the woman receptionist speaks hungarian a little!!) Molnar family from Hungary

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Winetaster_8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 nights at the Lux in October 2008. We didn't like our experience at all. The hotel area is not very nice, it is also too far from the city center. The room was small, not very clean and the noise from other rooms or from the stairs and front office was extremely disturbing. We had to start the fan from the room air condition system (not really working!) to cover the noise in order to sleep. The breakfest was not good and the facility cleanliness was questionnable. We were told by our travel agency that we could have breakfest outside on a terrasse. Forget about the terasse, you don't want to eat there. In the same price brackets, you can find better hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Amy124
Reviews.Content: I came here on a group trip in march and was absolutely shocked. my parents after staying the the St regis grand in december 07 announced that Rome was a beautiful city. Not where i was staying it wasn't. On arrival we were told that the coach couldnt go any further so we were told to walk to the hotel with all our bags. with 40 people that isnt so easy. the street of the hotel is lined with rubbish bins and graffiti and loud bars. the hotel is very small and only one lift out of two worked. althougth the hotel staff were pleasent it was clear they didnt understand english very well. my room was a twin room with two camp beds forced in too. meaning the four of us were in a room for two people. It was Unbelievably cramped!! we had to climb over the beds to get to the other side. the bathroom was alright although the shower was faulty. the hotel is very noisy at night time as there are many many school trips at the hotel. it is also very noisy from the street and we often found it hard to sleep. in the morning we were in for a shock. the breakfast was appaling. there was no hot food whatsoever. the only thing we could salvage was a rock hard slice of bread and some chocolate spread. even the fruit was off date! the table with food was also dirty and messy with food lying everywhere. we had to clean the tables ourselves and we usually found ourselves taking a plastic cup of watery hot-chocolate and heading straight back up to the room. luckily we only had to stay here for two night but on my way out of the hotel i seen it said 4 star, we had been told it was a 3 star. well it defiently was lower than that.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the most terrible hotel I have ever stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: fantasia112
Reviews.Content: I think the pictures I uploaded speak for themselves. I stayed with a group of 32 lately and I got to see all type of rooms on every floor. What a tragedy! Rooms are all very small and TV sets outdated. No international channels by the way when you are lucky enough to get a signal... This is not an hotel more like a Youth Hostel. They literally locked the front door from 2 to 5 am. The breakfast is appealing (both in quantity and content). For the same price, your money goes a long way anywhere else in Europe (especially in Spain where we got to stay in REAL four stars for the SAME price!) SHAME ON YOU LUX HOTEL!!!!!!!!! Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Meh...would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CanadianaSunshine
Reviews.Content: I was here with my family at the end of August. We chose this hotel because after spending a month in our hometown in southern Italy we wanted to see Roma and it's tourist attractions and I believe it was Nolitours that offered a series of hotels and tour packages. The location was pretty good...a short walk to some live roma action, and we spent an entire day walking to via del corso, shopping, and walking back. the area is a bit shaddy though and i wouldn't recommend walking alone after dark. the hotel room was TINY. thank goodness we were hardly in it unless to shower and sleep. We didnt have a bathtub just a shower. the A/C didn't work at all...we complained and they never came to fix it in the five nights we spent there. Speaking of the staff, they are horrible. there was one guy at the front desk who was really just a doorknob. It seemed if we spoke to him in english or italian he didnt get what we were saying. the breakfast was nasty. we always just went to grab a cup of hot chocolate before we left for our tours or personal walking trips very early in the morning. All in all, the hotel was crap. But, if you really just need a place to stay to sleep in, it's alright.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Small but Pretty Decent”
Reviews.Author: stefike
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend & I stayed at Hotel Lux at the end of May this year. Our first impression of the hotel was fairly decent. The lobby is nice and the staff is friendly and makes a great attempt to speak English. We arrived with other couples on our tour group and everyone got checked in pretty much right away. Our room however was on the main floor and was the size of my closet. I guess you don't end up spending that much time in your hotel anyway. When you walk into the room it's just your bed, 2 night stands, a desk, mini fridge (which we didn't know was there or had free drinks until the day we left), a TV, and a small safe in a cupboard beside the bed. The safe was great you could set your own combination and we used it a lot. The bathroom was pretty small, but it had an AMAZING bathtub (no shower.. just a shower head with no curtain or anything). After walking around the city for hours it was great to have a place to soak your feet. LOL. The rooms did not have a working A/C. This wouldn't have been a problem if we had the option of leaving our window open. Our room was located on the main floor in the back of building which faced the maintenance room. So basically our room looked into a cement room with all the water and electrical [----]. We always had to keep our windows closed and locked. There was a ladder outside our window that leads to the street so really anyone could have hopped the fence and walked into our room. Very Scary!!! Also, the workers would come down every morning and start yelling, banging on the pipes, walking back and forth outside our window and smoking at about 7:30am. Being on the ground level we also got to enjoy being woken up by the women setting up breakfast every morning; yelling.. table moving.. etc. We tried to change rooms but they were completely booked solid so we made the best of it. OH and just a quick note on the breakfast... it [-----------]! Breakfast consisted of warm cream on stale cereal, rock hard buns, meat left out in the air for hours getting all hard and crusty and juice. We only ate the first day and after that went out for Breakfast. If the staffs weren’t so friendly and helpful it would have made the trip a lot worse. They pointed us in the direction of great shops and things to see. The hotel was very central and easy to find. I would suggest staying there if you don't intend on staying in your hotel more than a couple of hours at night. Just don't stay on the ground level!!!!!!
